page.title: 02THE TONYREFAIL BY-PASS
page.content: A new By-pass is being made around Tonyrefail because of the large number of vehicles. The By-pass starts at {Coedely and ends at Williamstown in {the Rhondda}.A branch also goes from Tonyrefail to Trebanog for the traffic going to Porth. The new road is going to run on top of the old railway which runs beside the {River Ely.}The men who are building the new road have diverted the river. The new road is being built on top of the old railway because it is flat. The new road is six miles long .The new road is being built because there are traffic jams nearly every day. All the men must wear their helmets in case a lump of concrete falls on their head because they cauld be hurt very badly.So far only one man has been injured when he broke a collar bone.
